medical_history.chief_complaint: Epistaxis, pain and erythema of the right forearm, and pancytopenia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been healthy until 6 months before admission, when spontaneous, prolonged epistaxis episodes began. Two months prior to admission, he noticed spontaneous bruising on his arms and legs. Four days before admission, he experienced pain, swelling, and erythema in the distal right forearm, exacerbated by extension of the fourth and fifth fingers. He also developed fever, chills, night sweats, nausea, and frontal headache, with partial symptom relief after taking naproxen and acetaminophen.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Normal complete blood count approximately 10 years before admission; blood donation successful 6 months before admission.
medical_history.family_history: Father had coronary artery disease; paternal grandmother had lung cancer.
medical_history.social_history: Consumed alcohol three times per week; non-smoker; no illicit drug use; lived with wife and two healthy children; worked for a lighting company; no recent tick bites; sexually active with wife (who sustained a needlestick injury 2 years prior); travel history included Mexico (15 years ago), Puerto Rico (7 months ago), Missouri (6 months ago), Ohio (4 months ago), and New York (1 month ago).
